arm_group.description: Continue home dose of clopidogrel into surgery
Discontinue  home dose of clopidogrel one week before surgery.  Resume after surgery.

brief_summary.textblock:
Patients who on taking clopidogrel are randomized to either continue clopidogrel into
      general surgery or discontinue clopidogrel 7 days before surgery.  All patients resume
      clopidogrel after surgery.  The investigators track the development of bleeding
      complications that may develop within 90 days of the surgery.  Patients are medically
      cleared to be in either arm of the study by their cardiologist and surgeon.  There is
      currently no evidence to support for or against the use continuation or discontinuation of
      clopidogrel prior to general surgery.

clinical_study.brief_title: Does Continued Use of Clopidogrel Into Surgery Cause Increased Perioperative Bleeding?

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  taking clopidogrel

          -  undergoing general surgery

          -  cleared by both cardiologist and surgery for randomized arm

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  previous history of bleeding complications/bleeding disposition

          -  no capacity to consent

intervention.description: Continue home dose of clopidogrel into surgery
Discontinue  home dose of clopidogrel one week before surgery.  Resume after surgery.

facility.name: Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai

clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Clopidogrel Use in Peri-Operative General Surgery Patients: A Prospective Study

primary_outcome.description: Development of perioperative bleeding complications, including need for blood transfusions, hematoma, and bleeding requiring re-admission or re-operation

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Development of myocardial infarction or thrombosis

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Diagnostic
